original:
During the Romanesque and Early Gothic periods, churches in Germany featured wall paintings that reflected local interpretations of international styles. However, the names of many artists from this era remain largely unknown. 

The court of the Holy Roman Emperor, located in Prague, played a significant role in the development of the International Gothic style in the late 14th century. This style spread to the affluent cities of Northe
